title: Who are very important people in the history of the Pacific Northwest? - Quora

response.answer_text: A few major figures are: John Jacob Astor (the man who founded Fort Astoria, later Astoria Oregon) Thomas Jefferson (the man responsible for the Louisiana Purchase and the expedition of Lewis and Clarke, who once stated that a great and independent nation would develop there.) Sacagawea (Only one of the most famous native american names ever.) Meriwether Lewis and William Clarke(They need no introduction)  George Vancouver (The founder of modern day Vancouver British Columbia, who was noted for his great kindness and rapport with the natives of the northwest.)

This list covers a lumber baron, a suffragette, a founding father of Oregon and a Nez Perce Chief: Simon Benson The History of Simon Benson and His House Abigail Scott Duniway Abigail Scott Duniway Dr. John McLoughlin John McLoughlin (1784-1857) Chief Joseph PBS - THE WEST - Chief Joseph
